pg_granted_pgpubs_crosswalk.description: Flag indicating whether this row contains the most recent pgpub_id for a given application (TRUE = This pgpub_id refers to the most recent publication of this application; FALSE = This application has been re-published or corrected in a more recent publication)

Flag indicating whether this row contains the most recent patent_id for a given application (TRUE = This patent_id refers to the most recent patent granted to this application; FALSE = This patent has been withdrawn and re-issued under a more recent patent_id)

pg_applicant_not_disambiguated.description: order in which the party/applicant appears in the source XML file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.

The type of interest the applicant has in the intellectual property rights of a patent or application. May be equal to inventor, legal-representative, party-of-interest, obligated-assignee, assignee, or null.
first name of the party/applicant, if an individual
last name of the party/applicant, if an individual
organization of the party/applicant, if applicable

pg_assignee_disambiguated.description: order in which assignee appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.
unique assignee ID generated by the disambiguation algorithm
first name, if assignee is individual
last name, if assignee is individual
organization name if assignee is organization

assignee type (1- Unassigned, 2 - US Company or Corporation, 3 - Foreign Company or Corporation, 4 - US Individual, 5 - Foreign Individual, 6 - US Federal Government, 7 - Foreign Government, 8 - US County Government, 9 - US State Government. Note: A "1" appearing before any of these codes signifies part interest)
assignee's location. If the assignee's sequence number is 1, then his/her location is the "location" of the related patent

pg_assignee_not_disambiguated.description: order in which assignee appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.
unique assignee ID generated by the disambiguation algorithm
first name, if assignee is individual
last name, if assignee is individual
organization name if assignee is organization

assignee type (1- Unassigned, 2 - US Company or Corporation, 3 - Foreign Company or Corporation, 4 - US Individual, 5 - Foreign Individual, 6 - US Federal Government, 7 - Foreign Government, 8 - US County Government, 9 - US State Government. Note: A "1" appearing before any of these codes signifies part interest)
assignee's location. If the assignee's sequence number is 1, then his/her location is the "location" of the related patent

pg_claims_{year}.description: order in which claims appear in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.
sequence number of claim this is dependent on. NULL if independent
contains claim number of claim formatted as 0-prefixed 5 digit number

pg_cpc_at_issue.description: order in which the CPC classifications occur in the raw XML file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.
date corresponding to the version under which the classification was made

CPC section(A = Human Necessities, B = Performing Operations; Transporting, C = Chemistry; Metallurgy, D = Textiles; Paper, E = Fixed Constructions, F = Mechanical Engineering; Lighting; Heating; Weapons; Blasting Engines or Pumps, G = Physics, H = Electricity, Y = General Tagging of New Technological Developments)
CPC section id plus CPC class value
Date corresponding to the approval of the CPC classification

pg_cpc_current.description: order in which the CPC classifications occur in the raw XML file; sequence for this table begins at 0.
date corresponding to the version under which the classification was made

CPC section(A = Human Necessities, B = Performing Operations; Transporting, C = Chemistry; Metallurgy, D = Textiles; Paper, E = Fixed Constructions, F = Mechanical Engineering; Lighting; Heating; Weapons; Blasting Engines or Pumps, G = Physics, H = Electricity, Y = General Tagging of New Technological Developments)
CPC section id plus CPC class value

pg_detail_desc_text_{year}.description: full text of the detailed description

pg_draw_desc_text_{year}.description: order in which drawing descriptions appear in application file, often the same as the figure id; sequence for this table begins at {1}.

pg_foreign_priority.description: order in which priority claims appear in publication; sequence for this table begins at {1}
type of priority claim (international, national, regional)
date on which the foreign document was filed
country in which the foreign document was filed

pg_gov_interest_org.description: name of Federal department, agency, bureau, etc.

position of the focal agency in a hierarchical set of relationships with the parent agency (e.g., DHHS) at level_one and child agencies at lower levels (e.g., NIH at level_two and NIDA at level_three). government_organization.name is equal to one and only one of the values in level_one, level_two, and level_three

position of the focal agency in a hierarchical set of relationships with the parent agency (e.g., DHHS) at level_one and child agencies at lower levels (e.g., NIH at level_two and NIDA at level_three). government_organization.name is equal to one and only one of the values in level_one, level_two, and level_three

position of the focal agency in a hierarchical set of relationships with the parent agency (e.g., DHHS) at level_one and child agencies at lower levels (e.g., NIH at level_two and NIDA at level_three). government_organization.name is equal to one and only one of the values in level_one, level_two, and level_three

pg_inventor_disambiguated.description: order in which the inventor appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique inventor id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
inventor attributed gender (F = female, M = male, U = no gender attributed)
inventor's location. If the inventor's sequence number is 0, then his/her location is the "location" of the related patent

pg_inventor_not_disambiguated.description: order in which the inventor appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
unique inventor id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
flag determining whether the inventor is deceased or not
inventor's location. If the inventor's sequence number is 0, then his/her location is the "location" of the related patent

pg_ipc_at_issue.description: order in which IPC class appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.

IPC section (A = Human Necessities, B = Performing Operations; Transporting, C = Chemistry; Metallurgy, D = Textiles; Paper, E = Fixed Constructions, F = Mechanical Engineering; Lighting; Heating; Weapons; Blasting, G = Physics, H = Electricity)
IPC classification value ( I = invention information; N = non-invention information)
IPC classification status ( B = Basic or Original)
IPC classification data source ( H = Human - Generated; M = Machine - Generated; G = Generated via Software)
issue date of the patent grant

pg_location_disambiguated.description: unique location id generated by the disambiguation algorithm
state FIPS code associated with a location_id
county FIPS code associated with a location_id

pg_location_not_disambiguated.description: unique location id generated by the disambiguation algorithm

pg_pct_data.description: PCT Section 371(c)(1)(2)(4)date, date when pct application was filed
kind of application (numerical for filed, alphabetical for published)
whether the document has been published or just filed

pg_persistent_assignee.description: the disambiguated assignee ids associated with the raw assignee on a given pgpub document with the given sequence during the data updates matching the date stamps in the field names. Data on this table goes back to the 20201229 update.
order in which assignee appears in application file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.

pg_persistent_inventor.description: the disambiguated inventor ids associated with the raw inventor on a given pgpub document with the given sequence during the data updates matching the date stamps in the field names. Data on this table goes back to the 20210330 update.
order in which inventor appears in application file; sequence for this table begins at {0}.

pg_published_application.description: flag for inventor who was unable to be contacted at filing of application
name of XML file from which the data was parsed

pg_rel_app_text.description: text of the description of the related application in question

pg_us_rel_doc.description: country where related document was published
publication date of the related document
order in which the related document appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.

pg_uspc_at_issue.description: order in which uspc class appears in patent file; sequence for this table begins at {1}.

pg_wipo_technology.description: order in which WIPO technology field appears on patent; sequence for this table begins at {0}.
WIPO technology field id as derived from crosswalk http://www.wipo.int/export/sites/www/ipstats/en/statistics/patents/xls/ipc_technology.xls
